episodes.title: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
episodes.description: Homer's Christmas bonus is canceled and the rainy-day funds are needed for Bart's tattoo removal.

episodes.title: Bart the Genius
episodes.description: Bart is moved to a school for the gifted after he switches aptitude tests with another boy.

episodes.title: Homer's Odyssey
episodes.description: After being fired from the nuclear power plant for negligence, Homer becomes a safety activist.

episodes.title: There's No Disgrace Like Home
episodes.description: After seeing families being nice to each other, Homer orders the Simpsons to a therapist.

episodes.title: Bart the General
episodes.description: Bart seeks counsel from Grandpa Simpson, who takes him to a warfare expert for basic training.

episodes.title: Moaning Lisa
episodes.description: Second grade has Lisa playing the blues solo. Homer seeks tutelage to beat Bart at video boxing.

episodes.title: The Call of the Simpsons
episodes.description: The Simpsons' RV goes over a cliff and Homer and Bart go for help, get lost and lose their clothes.

episodes.title: The Telltale Head
episodes.description: Bart pulls a stunt that shocks the entire town, including the new friends he was trying to impress.

episodes.title: Life on the Fast Lane
episodes.description: Homer's gift for Marge prompts her to take up bowling - and an instructor who teaches "many things."

episodes.title: Homer's Night Out
episodes.description: Shutterbug Bart captures Homer with a sexy entertainer at a bachelor party.

episodes.title: Crepes of Wrath
episodes.description: A story about how Bart saves France after blowing up Principal Skinner's mom with a cherry bomb.

episodes.title: Krusty Gets Busted
episodes.description: Bart's TV hero Krusty the Clown is arrested for a robbery, and Homer must testify against the clown.

episodes.title: Some Enchanted Evening
episodes.description: Homer and Marge leave the kids with a sitter who's on "America's most armed and dangerous."

episodes.title: Bart Gets an "F"
episodes.description: Bart gives the class brain antigeek lessons, but regrets it when the brain becomes too Bart-like.

episodes.title: Simpson and Delilah
episodes.description: Homer receives a promotion, a key to the executive washroom and an invaluable secretary.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror
episodes.description: Tales include a haunted house, a misunderstanding with aliens and a rendition of "The Raven."

episodes.title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
episodes.description: Mr. Burns wants to be governor to lower nuclear safety standards to keep his plant on line.

episodes.title: Dancin' Homer
episodes.description: Homer's success as the mascot of a minor league ball club earns him a shot at the majors.

episodes.title: Dead Putting Society
episodes.description: Lisa gives Bart tips on handling the pressure in a mini-golf grudge match with a neighbor's son.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
episodes.description: On Thanksgiving, Bart runs away after accidentally wrecking Lisa's centerpiece.

episodes.title: Bart the Daredevil
episodes.description: After seeing a truck rally, Bart discovers his reason for living - a career in death defiance.

episodes.title: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge
episodes.description: Marge's protests over cartoon violence lead to a cultural renaissance in Springfield.

episodes.title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
episodes.description: A lawyer suggests there may be profit in the pain after Bart's collision with Mr. Burns' car.

episodes.title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
episodes.description: Homer takes to sushi but a chef may have given Homer some bad blowfish - and 24 hours to live.

episodes.title: The Way We Was
episodes.description: Marge and Homer reveal how they met and the prom they attended.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment
episodes.description: After learning hell is the price for stealing, Lisa would rather go to heaven than watch pirated TV.

episodes.title: Principal Charming
episodes.description: Bart benefits when Principal Skinner falls for his Aunt Patty, who has Skinner but doesn't want him.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
episodes.description: Homer's wealthy long-lost half-brother makes the mistake of giving Homer an important job.

episodes.title: Bart's Dog Gets an 'F'
episodes.description: Bart's dog is sent to obedience school after he destroys Homer's expensive new sneaks.

episodes.title: Old Money
episodes.description: Grampa loses his love, leaving him with a heavy heart and a heavy wallet from the money in her will.

episodes.title: Brush with Greatness
episodes.description: Marge gets to paint a portrait of Mr. Burns.

episodes.title: Lisa's Substitute
episodes.description: Homer pales in comparison with Lisa's teacher, as does Bart with his opponent for class president.

episodes.title: The War of the Simpsons
episodes.description: Homer and Marge attend a marriage retreat, where Homer catches a legendary fish - and maybe more.

episodes.title: Three Men and a Comic Book
episodes.description: Bart earns less than expected doing chores, so he partners with Milhouse and Martin on a rare comic.

episodes.title: Blood Feud
episodes.description: Bart's blood saves Mr. Burns and Homer sends his boss a nasty letter.

episodes.title: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
episodes.description: Bart flies in The Spirit of St. Louis and Lisa gets Congress to save the Springfield forest.

episodes.title: When Flanders Failed
episodes.description: Ned Flanders announces he’s opening a new store devoted to merchandise for left-handers.

episodes.title: Bart the Murderer
episodes.description: While his class enjoys a field trip, Bart becomes a Goodfella under Springfield mob boss Fat Tony.

episodes.title: Homer Defined
episodes.description: When Homer saves the nuclear plant from a meltdown, he wins praise but feels he owes it all to luck.

episodes.title: Like Father, Like Clown
episodes.description: At a dinner with the Simpsons, Krusty the Clown reveals he is estranged from his rabbi father.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror II
episodes.description: Maggie uses a wish, Bart rules Springfield and Homer donates his brain to a science project.

episodes.title: Lisa's Pony
episodes.description: Homer buys Lisa a pony, but now he must get a second job - at Apu's Kwik-E-Mart.

episodes.title: Saturdays of Thunder
episodes.description: Homer helps Bart build a soapbox racer; It does little for the car but a lot for their relationship.

episodes.title: Flaming Moe's
episodes.description: Moe takes Homer's cocktail recipe without crediting Homer, and his bar flourishes.

episodes.title: Burns Verkaufen der Kraftwerk
episodes.description: When the Germans assume control of Mr. Burns' plant, they discover it is not the bargain it seems.

episodes.title: I Married Marge
episodes.description: In a flashback, we see Homer attempt to land a job at the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant.

episodes.title: Radio Bart
episodes.description: Bart fools the town into thinking there's a little boy trapped in a well.

episodes.title: Lisa the Greek
episodes.description: Homer discovers Lisa's knack for picking football winners, which he exploits.

episodes.title: Homer Alone
episodes.description: When Marge goes to a local spa, she leaves Bart and Lisa with Patty and Selma and Maggie with Homer.

episodes.title: Bart the Lover
episodes.description: Bart gets back at his teacher by answering her personal ad as a perfect, but fictitious, lover.

episodes.title: Homer at the Bat
episodes.description: Homer rules the company softball team until Mr. Burns decides to hire professional baseball players.

episodes.title: Separate Vocations
episodes.description: Scholastic tests show Lisa will not be the saxophone player she dreams of becoming.

episodes.title: Dog of Death
episodes.description: After lottery fever grips Springfield, the Simpsons discover their dog needs an expensive operation.

episodes.title: Colonel Homer
episodes.description: Homer runs off to a country-western bar, where he discovers beautiful songstress Lurleen Lumpkin.

episodes.title: Black Widower
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob reappears and wishes to marry Selma. Bart's convinced his old nemesis is up to no good.

episodes.title: The Otto Show
episodes.description: When Otto loses his license he moves in with the Simpsons, whom try to help him get his job back.

episodes.title: Bart's Friend Falls in Love
episodes.description: After a sex education class, Milhouse falls in love with a beautiful new girl, Samantha Stanky.

episodes.title: Brother Can You Spare Two Dimes
episodes.description: Mr. Burns discovers that Homer is sterile, and placates him with an award presented by Joe Frazier.

episodes.title: Kamp Krusty
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa are horrified when their summer at Kamp Krusty turns into a nightmare.

episodes.title: A Streetcar Named Marge
episodes.description: Marge wins the lead in a musical and while at day care, Maggie's pacifier is taken from her.

episodes.title: Homer the Heretic
episodes.description: Homer burns the house down and is saved by the local fire department, manned by volunteers of faith.

episodes.title: Lisa the Beauty Queen
episodes.description: An artist does an unflattering portrait of Lisa, so she enters a pageant to regain self-esteem.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror III
episodes.description: A doll goes berserk and Lisa's attempt to revive her dead cat turns the town into zombies.

episodes.title: Itchy and Scratchy: The Movie
episodes.description: When Bart is grossly negligent, Homer forbids him from seeing the new Itchy and Scratchy movie.

episodes.title: Marge Gets a Job
episodes.description: Mr. Burns develops a crush on Marge. Meanwhile, Bart becomes the boy who cried "wolf" - literally

episodes.title: New Kid on the Block
episodes.description: Bart falls in love with his new teenage neighbor. Meanwhile, Homer sues a seafood restaurant.

episodes.title: Mr. Plow
episodes.description: Homer and Barney become competitors in the snow plowing business.

episodes.title: Lisa's First Word
episodes.description: In a flashback, we see the birth of Lisa and young Bart's jealousy towards her.

episodes.title: Homer's Triple Bypass
episodes.description: Homer must get a bypass operation, but is only able to afford the cut-rate doctor, Nick Riviera.

episodes.title: Marge vs. the Monorail
episodes.description: A con man sells the people of Springfield a monorail, but Marge warns that it's a mistake.

episodes.title: Selma's Choice
episodes.description: A death sends the Simpsons to a funeral, and makes Selma wonder if she should have a child.

episodes.title: Brother from the Same Planet
episodes.description: Bart gets a "Big Brother" who takes care of him and out of jealousy, Homer gets a "Little Brother."

episodes.title: I Love Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa gives Ralph Wiggum a valentine and he develops a huge crush on her.

episodes.title: Duffless
episodes.description: When Homer's arrested for a DUI, he uses the opportunity to find out what life is like without beer.

episodes.title: Last Exit to Springfield
episodes.description: Lisa needs braces and Mr. Burns tries to remove the dental plan from the employees' benefits.

episodes.title: So It's Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.description: Bart's prank hospitalizes Homer, whose life flashes by (in past clips) before he goes into a coma.

episodes.title: The Front
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa write Itchy & Scratchy cartoons using Grampa to submit them to the studio.

episodes.title: Whacking Day
episodes.description: Barry White helps Lisa to save snakes from Whacking Day and Bart is expelled from school.

episodes.title: Marge in Chains
episodes.description: Marge shoplifts and is sent to a women's prison, leaving the family to fend for themselves.

episodes.title: Krusty Gets Kancelled
episodes.description: When Krusty is taken off the air, he must do a comeback special to save his career.

episodes.title: Homer's Barbershop Quartet
episodes.description: The Simpsons discover an old barbershop quartet album starring Homer.

episodes.title: Cape Feare
episodes.description: An anonymous writer makes threats to Bart and the Simpsons discover it is Sideshow Bob.

episodes.title: Homer Goes to College
episodes.description: Homer returns to college and tries to turn his collegiate experience into a rowdy riot.

episodes.title: Rosebud
episodes.description: When Maggie gets Mr. Burns' childhood teddy bear from Bart, it leads to a struggle for ownership.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror IV
episodes.description: Vampire Burns invites the Simpsons for dinner and Bart sees a gremlin damaging his school bus.

episodes.title: Marge on the Lam
episodes.description: When Chief Wiggum pulls over Marge's neighbor, she flees because she stole her ex-husband's car.

episodes.title: Bart's Inner Child
episodes.description: Homer buys a trampoline which injures many of the neighborhood children.

episodes.title: Boy Scoutz N the Hood
episodes.description: Bart and Millhouse join the boy scouts. Homer and Ned accompany the scouts on a rafting trip.

episodes.title: The Last Temptation of Homer
episodes.description: Marge fears for her marriage when Homer gets a beautiful new coworker, Mindy Simmons.

episodes.title: $pringfield
episodes.description: Springfield legalizes gambling, leading Mr. Burns to open a casino and Marge becomes an addict.

episodes.title: Homer the Vigilante
episodes.description: Homer tries to unsuccessfully catch a thief until they learn from Grampa the nemesis is an old man.

episodes.title: Bart Gets Famous
episodes.description: Krusty the Clown hires Bart as an assistant, and a sketch catapults him to celebrity.

episodes.title: Homer and Apu
episodes.description: Homer accompanies Apu to the Kwik-E-Mart home office -- in India -- after Apu is fired.

episodes.title: Lisa vs. Malibu Stacy
episodes.description: Lisa, upset by the sexism displayed by a talking Malibu Stacy Doll, tracks down the creator.

episodes.title: Deep Space Homer
episodes.description: In an attempt to send an average man into space, Homer and Barney are recruited as astronauts.

episodes.title: Homer Loves Flanders
episodes.description: Flanders invites Homer to a game and Homer decides he's been too hard on his neighbor.

episodes.title: Bart Gets an Elephant
episodes.description: When Bart wins an elephant that is ill-behaved and uncontrollable, the other pets feel neglected.

episodes.title: Burns' Heir
episodes.description: Mr. Burns holds auditions for an heir and after Bart vandalizes his mansion, Mr. Burns chooses him.

episodes.title: Sweet Seymour Skinner's Baadasssss Song
episodes.description: When Principle Skinner loses his job, Ned Flanders replaces him and Skinner returns to the army.

episodes.title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
episodes.description: Bart witnesses a dispute where the mayor's nephew, Freddy, is accused of a crime and goes on trial.

episodes.title: Lady Bouvier's Lover
episodes.description: Marge's mother is wooed by both Homer's father and Homer's boss.

episodes.title: Secrets of a Successful Marriage
episodes.description: Homer goes to take an adult education class, but decides to teach one instead.

episodes.title: Bart of Darkness
episodes.description: Homer installs a pool in the Simpson backyard and Bart breaks his leg attempting to dive into it.

episodes.title: Lisa's Rival
episodes.description: A new student becomes Lisa's rival, so Lisa enlists Bart to sabotage her rival's project.

episodes.title: Another Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.description: A family discussion of love yields stories that all end in heartbreak.

episodes.title: Itchy & Scratchyland
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa ask their parents to go to Itchy & ScratchyLand, where they get attacked by robots.

episodes.title: Sideshow Bob Roberts
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob runs for mayor as the candidate of Springfield's Republican party - and wins.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror V
episodes.description: The Simpsons are employed on Mr. Burns' country estate and Homer goes insane.

episodes.title: Bart's Girlfriend
episodes.description: Bart is blamed for money theft from the church collection plate, and Lisa must prove his innocence.

episodes.title: Lisa On Ice
episodes.description: Lisa becomes a hockey goalie. Bart plays for another team, and the two start a rivalry.

episodes.title: Homer Badman
episodes.description: Homer's actions are mistaken for an inappropriate sexual advance, and Homer is vilified around town

episodes.title: Grandpa vs. Sexual Inadequacy
episodes.description: When Grampa and Homer travel selling an elixir Grampa reveals that Homer's conception was unplanned.

episodes.title: Fear of Flying
episodes.description: Homer receives free airline tickets and discovers Marge is afraid to fly, so she goes to therapy.

episodes.title: Homer the Great
episodes.description: Homer becomes the leader of a Masonic cult with immense secret power, known as The Stonecutters.

episodes.title: And Maggie Makes Three
episodes.description: Homer explains the story of Maggie's birth.

episodes.title: Bart's Comet
episodes.description: Bart discovers a comet, which turns out to be on a collision course with Earth.

episodes.title: Homie the Clown
episodes.description: Homer resembles Krusty, leading to life-enhancing opportunities – until he is captured by mobsters.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Australia
episodes.description: Bart visits Australia to apologize for a $900 collect call, and moons the Prime Minister instead.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Patty and Selma
episodes.description: Homer must borrow money from Marge's sisters, who humiliate him until they forgive the loan.

episodes.title: A Star Is Burns
episodes.description: A film critic comes to Springfield for a film festival and some townspeople enter their films.

episodes.title: Lisa's Wedding
episodes.description: A fortuneteller predicts Lisa's engagement to a fellow student from an upper-crust British family.

episodes.title: Two Dozen and One Greyhounds
episodes.description: The Simpsons end up with a 25 puppies, but Mr. Burns wants the little dogs for nefarious purposes.

episodes.title: The PTA Disbands
episodes.description: When Springfield Elementary teachers go on strike, parents step in to teach the classes.

episodes.title: Round Springfield
episodes.description: While visiting Bart in the hospital, Lisa discovers jazzman Bleeding Gums Murphy is also there.

episodes.title: The Springfield Connection
episodes.description: Marge becomes a cop and discovers the work is not as much fun as she anticipated.

episodes.title: Lemon of Troy
episodes.description: When a popular Springfield lemon tree is stolen by kids from Shelbyville, Bart vows to get it back.

episodes.title: Who Shot Mr. Burns? - Part II
episodes.description: Chief Wiggum investigates who shot Mr. Burns in an episode that parodies TV dramas.

episodes.title: Radioactive Man
episodes.description: When a movie based on comic is filmed in town, the part of the hero’s sidekick  goes to Milhouse.

episodes.title: Home Sweet Homediddly-Dum-Doodily
episodes.description: After some misadventures, the Simpson children are put in the custody of Ned and Maude Flanders

episodes.title: Bart Sells His Soul
episodes.description: When Bart sells his soul to Milhouse for five dollars, he comes to regret his decision.

episodes.title: Lisa the Vegetarian
episodes.description: When Lisa no longer can eat lamb, she is ridiculed and resented by her father and friends.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VI
episodes.description: /logos attack Springfield, Groundskeeper Willie terrorizes children and Homer enters a 3D world.

episodes.title: King-Size Homer
episodes.description: Homer gains weight to claim a disability and work at home, but his life starts falling apart.

episodes.title: Mother Simpson
episodes.description: Homer’s mother returns to the Simpsons and the family learns that she was a radical in the 1960s.

episodes.title: Sideshow Bob's Last Gleamings
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob returns to Springfield and he tries to destroy Krusty with the Wright Brothers’ plane.

episodes.title: The Simpsons 138th Episode Spectacular
episodes.description: This episode features never-before-seen clips and  alternate endings for the “Who Shot Mr. Burns?”.

episodes.title: Marge Be Not Proud
episodes.description: When Bart's shoplifting arrest disappoints his mother, he desperately tries to win back her respect.

episodes.title: Team Homer
episodes.description: Homer is forced to include Mr. Burns on the bowling team to raise enough money for the entry fee.

episodes.title: Two Bad Neighbors
episodes.description: Former President George H.W. Bush buys a home across the street from the Simpsons.

episodes.title: Scenes from the Class Struggle in Springfield
episodes.description: Homer discovers Mr. Burns cheats at golf while Marge discovers she doesn’t fit the upper-class life.

episodes.title: Bart the Fink
episodes.description: When Krusty the clown fakes his death, Bart tries to convince him to return to society

episodes.title: Lisa the Iconoclast
episodes.description: Lisa discovers that Jebediah Springfield, the founder of her town, was in reality a terrible man.

episodes.title: Homer the Smithers
episodes.description: After Mr. Burns fires Smithers, he falls out a window and depends upon his long-time aide again.

episodes.title: The Day the Violence Died
episodes.description: Bart meets the creator of Itchy and Scratchy and helps him sue Itchy & Scratchy Studios.

episodes.title: A Fish Called Selma
episodes.description: Actor Troy McClure marries Marge’s sister in order to conceal a sexual fetish of his from the world.

episodes.title: Bart On the Road
episodes.description: While at the DMV, Bart creates a fake driver’s license and drives to Knoxville, Tennessee.

episodes.title: 22 Short Films About Springfield
episodes.description: Skinner and Chalmers have dinner, Maggie gets locked in a box and Nelson gets what he deserves.

episodes.title: Raging Abe Simpson and His Grumbling Grandson in "the Curse of the Flying Hellfish"
episodes.description: Grampa will inherit a fortune as the last survivor of an old army unit if Mr. Burns dies before him.

episodes.title: Much Apu About Nothing
episodes.description: Springfield outlaws illegal immigrants and so Apu tries to pass a citizenship test.

episodes.title: Homerpalooza
episodes.description: Homer joins rock bands around the country, entertaining audiences by catching cannonballs.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VII
episodes.description: Bart meets his Siamese twin, Lisa's science project attacks Bart and aliens invade the '96 election.

episodes.title: You Only Move Twice
episodes.description: Homer gets a new job and the family moves, only to find out his new employer is an evil millionaire.

episodes.title: The Homer They Fall
episodes.description: Moe urges Homer to become a professional boxer.

episodes.title: Burns, Baby Burns
episodes.description: The Simpsons are amazed to discover that Mr. Burns has a long-lost son, Larry.

episodes.title: Bart After Dark
episodes.description: Bart gets a job at the Maison Derriere, an after-hours club of ill repute, much to Marge’s chagrin.

episodes.title: A Milhouse Divided
episodes.description: Milhouse’s parents are divorcing, and Homer becomes concerned that his own marriage is in trouble.

episodes.title: Lisa's Date with Density
episodes.description: Lisa has a romance with Nelson. Homer’s use of a telephone auto-dialer runs him afoul of the law.

episodes.title: Hurricane Neddy
episodes.description: A hurricane blows through town, destroying Ned Flanders’ home, but leaving the Simpsons unscathed.

episodes.title: The Mysterious Voyage of Homer
episodes.description: Homer's immersed in an out-of body experience and a talking coyote urges him to find his soul mate.

episodes.title: The Springfield Files
episodes.description: Homer sees an alien, but no one believes him. He camps out with Bart, and they discover the truth.

episodes.title: The Twisted World Of Marge Simpson
episodes.description: Marge starts a pretzel franchise, but her attempts are thwarted by a group of women.

episodes.title: Mountain of Madness
episodes.description: During a survivalist company retreat, an avalanche traps Homer and Mr. Burns in a small cabin.

episodes.title: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala(Annoyed Grunt)cious
episodes.description: Marge’s hair begins to fall out from stress, but a singing nanny, Shary Bobbins, arrives to help.

episodes.title: The Itchy & Scratchy & Poochie Show
episodes.description: The Itchy & Scratchy writers add a new character, who is voiced by Homer Simpson.

episodes.title: Homer's Phobia
episodes.description: Homer's fearful about the potential influence that the Simpsons' new gay friend may have on Bart.

episodes.title: Brother from Another Series
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob returns to Springfield, this time with his evil brother, Cecil.

episodes.title: My Sister, My Sitter
episodes.description: Homer and Marge go out and  put Lisa in charge of Bart, who nearly kills himself.

episodes.title: Homer vs. the Eighteenth Amendment
episodes.description: Homer becomes a bootlegger when Springfield decides to enforce a 200-Year-Old prohibition decree.

episodes.title: Grade School Confidential
episodes.description: A principal and teacher begin a secret romance. When Bart reveals it, they nearly lose their jobs.

episodes.title: The Canine Mutiny
episodes.description: When Bart decides to get back Santa's Little Helper, he finds him living with a blind man.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the Lisa
episodes.description: Mr. Burns loses all his money and vowing to make back his fortune, he does it. through recycling.

episodes.title: In Marge We Trust
episodes.description: Marge attempts to assist Reverend Lovejoy and becomes more popular than the Reverend.

episodes.title: Homer's Enemy
episodes.description: A new employee at the nuclear plant is disgusted by Homer’s laziness and popularity.

episodes.title: Simpsons' Spin-Off Showcase
episodes.description: Grampa’s spirit inhabits the Love Tester at Moe’s and the family gets a smarmy variety show.

episodes.title: The City of New York vs. Homer Simpson
episodes.description: When Homer travels to New York, he recalls an experience he had in Manhattan when he was younger.

episodes.title: The Principal and the Pauper
episodes.description: The townspeople are stunned to learn Seymour Skinner may not be who they thought.

episodes.title: Lisa the Simpson
episodes.description: Lisa learn that smarts in the Simpson family are passed down in a very surprising manner.

episodes.title: Lisa's Sax
episodes.description: Lisa’s saxophone is destroyed and her family tells her how she came to get it.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror VIII
episodes.description: Homer battles mutants; Bart is morphed with a fly; Marge is accused of being a witch.

episodes.title: The Cartridge Family
episodes.description: A riot leads Homer to buy a gun to protect his family. Marge makes him promise to get rid of it.

episodes.title: Bart Star
episodes.description: When Homer becomes coach of the football team, he replaces Nelson with the less talented Bart.

episodes.title: The Two Mrs. Nahasapeemapetilans
episodes.description: Apu’s pre-arranged bride, Manjula, comes to town. After trying to escape, Apu agrees to be married.

episodes.title: Lisa the Skeptic
episodes.description: A skeleton is discovered in Springfield that seems to have come from an angel.

episodes.title: Realty Bites
episodes.description: Marge becomes a real estate agent, but is too honest. Homer buys a convertible at an auction.

episodes.title: Miracle On Evergreen Terrace
episodes.description: The town takes pity on the Simpsons, then are furious when they realize they have been fooled.

episodes.title: All Singing, All Dancing
episodes.description: Homer's declared distaste for musicals prompts flashbacks to song-and-dance scenes from the past.

episodes.title: Bart Carny
episodes.description: The Simpsons lose their home to a crafty carnival roadie and his son.

episodes.title: The Joy of Sect
episodes.description: Homer is lured into a cult that grows popular in Springfield.

episodes.title: Das Bus
episodes.description: The bus crashes, stranding the kids on a deserted island. Meanwhile, Homer takes on Bill Gates.

episodes.title: The Last Temptation of Krust
episodes.description: Krusty realizes his material isn't young and hip, so he attempts to reconnect with his audience.

episodes.title: Dumbbell Indemnity
episodes.description: Moe attempts insurance fraud. He lets Homer take the rap for his crime, and Homer plots revenge.

episodes.title: This Little Wiggy
episodes.description: Bart befriends Ralph Wiggum and gets a key to the town, leading them to endanger the mayor’s life.

episodes.title: Simpson Tide
episodes.description: Homer and friends join the Naval Reserve. He seizes control of a nuclear sub and causes an incident.

episodes.title: Trouble with Trillions
episodes.description: Homer helps entrap Mr. Burns and learns of the existence of a mysterious trillion-dollar bill.

episodes.title: Girly Edition
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa land jobs doing a children’s edition of the news and Homer obtains a monkey, Mojo.

episodes.title: Trash of the Titans
episodes.description: Homer defeats the sanitation commissioner with a dirty campaign and a slew of crazy promises.

episodes.title: King of the Hill
episodes.description: Homer attempts to get into shape by eating nutritional bars and working out.

episodes.title: Lost Our Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa gets lost in a part of town and Homer must get her. Then they discover an age-old secret.

episodes.title: Lard of the Dance
episodes.description: Lisa's friend wants Springfield Elementary kids to act older and Homer tries to sell excess grease.

episodes.title: Wizard of Evergreen Terrace
episodes.description: Homer is inspired by Thomas Edison. A trip to the museum makes him feel that he is not a failure.

episodes.title: Bart, The Mother
episodes.description: Bart accidentally kills another bird and feels so guilty that he raises her eggs as his own.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror IX
episodes.description: A hairpiece wreaks havoc, Bart and Lisa enter a cartoon, and the family learns who fathered Maggie.

episodes.title: When You Dish Upon a Star
episodes.description: A parasailing mishap leads Homer to become the personal assistant for a celebrity couple.

episodes.title: D'oh-In' in the Wind
episodes.description: Homer learns his middle name and befriends a pair of counter-culture entrepreneurs.

episodes.title: Lisa Gets an 'A'
episodes.description: Lisa buys an exam from Nelson. The tainted grade she gets qualifies the school for extra funding.

episodes.title: Homer Simpson in: "Kidney Trouble"
episodes.description: Grampa Simpson needs a new kidney, but before he will donate, Homer flees to a ship of lost souls.

episodes.title: Mayored to the Mob
episodes.description: When a convention ends in a riot, Homer becomes the Mayor's bodyguard and earns Fat Tony's enmity.

episodes.title: Viva Ned Flanders
episodes.description: Homer and Ned enjoy a bender in Las Vegas but when they wake up, they find they have extra wives.

episodes.title: Wild Barts Can't Be Broken
episodes.description: When Homer and friends trash the town, Springfield’s children are blamed for the damage.

episodes.title: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday
episodes.description: Homer and his friends travel to the Super Bowl and discover their tickets are fakes.

episodes.title: Homer to the Max
episodes.description: A popular TV character named Homer Simpson forces our Homer to change his name.

episodes.title: I'm with Cupid
episodes.description: The wives of Springfield are jealous of the attention Apu lavishes on his wife Manjula.

episodes.title: Marge Simpson In: "Screaming Yellow Honkers"
episodes.description: Marge gets an SUV and discovers road rage, but must sacrifice her car to save the family.

episodes.title: Make Room for Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa becomes Bart’s unwanted roommate. The stress leads Lisa to a sensory deprivation tank.

episodes.title: Maximum Homerdrive
episodes.description: Homer becomes a truck driver and discovers a secret. Meanwhile, Marge and Lisa meet Señor Ding-Dong.

episodes.title: Simpsons Bible Stories
episodes.description: Elementary students must slave away for Pharaoh Skinner, and Bart and Nelson are David and Goliath.

episodes.title: Mom and Pop Art
episodes.description: Homer becomes a found artist but when his public turns on him, he floods the town.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the 'C' Student
episodes.description: Bart must help the senior citizens as punishment. Meanwhile, Homer attempts to sell springs.

episodes.title: Monty Can't Buy Me Love
episodes.description: To get the public on his side, Mr. Burns, with Homer’s help, captures the Loch Ness Monster.

episodes.title: They Saved Lisa's Brain
episodes.description: Lisa bands together with other Springfield Mensa members to try to turn the town into a utopia.

episodes.title: 30 Minutes Over Tokyo
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit Japan, lose their savings and must become contestants on a game show to get home.

episodes.title: Beyond Blunderdome
episodes.description: Homer befriends Mel Gibson and convinces him to make the film more violent, with disastrous results.

episodes.title: Brother's Little Helper
episodes.description: Bart is given medication to help his concentration and he starts believing in a conspiracy.

episodes.title: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner?
episodes.description: Homer uses his food knowledge to become a restaurant critic.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror X
episodes.description: The Simpsons killed Ned Flanders? Lisa and Bart are superheroes, and Homer's horrific tales of Y2K.

episodes.title: E'i E'i (Annoyed Grunt)
episodes.description: The Simpsons move to a farm and discover tomatoes, tobacco, and radioactivity make a new substance.

episodes.title: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder
episodes.description: Homer bowls a perfect 300 game and reconnects with the world by bonding with baby Maggie.

episodes.title: Eight Misbehavin'
episodes.description: Apu and wife Manjula give birth to octuplets and desperate for money, Apu loans them to a promoter.

episodes.title: Take My Wife, Sleaze
episodes.description: Homer wins a motorcycle and joins a gang. But when a tougher gang takes Marge, he must win her back.

episodes.title: Grift of the Magi
episodes.description: The school goes bankrupt and is taken over by a 'child development' corporation.

episodes.title: Little Big Mom
episodes.description: Marge leaves to recuperate from a skiing injury and Lisa convinces Homer and Bart they have leprosy.

episodes.title: Faith Off
episodes.description: Bart has the powers of a healer and Fat Tony tries to turn his abilities in a sinister direction.

episodes.title: The Mansion Family
episodes.description: Mr. Burns visits the Mayo Clinic and lets Homer house sit his mansion, which leads to a knife fight.

episodes.title: Saddlesore Gallactica
episodes.description: Homer and Bart befriend a horse at a county fair and turn it into a racehorse with an attitude.

episodes.title: Alone Again, Natura-Diddly
episodes.description: Maude is killed by a T-shirt accident at a race. Homer and his family then try to help Ned cope.

episodes.title: Missionary: Impossible
episodes.description: Homer flees and becomes a missionary on an island where he introduces natives to casino gambling.

episodes.title: Pygmoelion
episodes.description: Plastic surgery gives Moe a handsome new face and a whole new life as a soap opera star.

episodes.title: Bart to the Future
episodes.description: In the future, Bart is a grown-up slacker while Lisa is no less than President of the United States.

episodes.title: Days of Wine and D'oh'ses
episodes.description: Barney vows to sober up. Newly clean, he gets work as a helicopter pilot.

episodes.title: Kill the Alligator and Run
episodes.description: Homer takes the family to Florida during spring break and kill a beloved alligator.

episodes.title: Last Tap Dance in Springfield
episodes.description: Lisa enters a dancing academy where the teacher never grew up and  Homer gets laser eye surgery.

episodes.title: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
episodes.description: Otto's dumped bride goes to live with the Simpsons, and the family believes Marge has lost her mind.

episodes.title: Behind the Laughter
episodes.description: We learn about the Simpsons' rise, fall and ultimate reconciliation with the aid of Willie Nelson.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XI
episodes.description: Homer's horoscope foretells his death and the Simpsons live out Grimm's fairy tales.

episodes.title: A Tale of Two Springfields
episodes.description: A wall goes up after a new area code divides the town, and only The Who's music can bring it down.

episodes.title: Insane Clown Poppy
episodes.description: Krusty discovers a daughter he never knew about. To win her love, he must get back a violin.

episodes.title: Lisa the Tree Hugger
episodes.description: Lisa has a crush on an environmental activist, but nearly turns a forest into an amusement park.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Dignity
episodes.description: Desperate for money, Homer becomes Burns' personal prankster.

episodes.title: The Computer Wore Menace Shoes
episodes.description: Homer becomes an internet blogger and lands himself on a secret island from which he must escape.

episodes.title: The Great Money Caper
episodes.description: Bart and Homer con Springfield residents out of their money, so Marge decides to grift the grifters.

episodes.title: Skinner's Sense of Snow
episodes.description: The kids get snowed in while at school, so Homer and Flanders try to save them.

episodes.title: HOMR
episodes.description: Homer undergoes a treatment to make himself smarter and becomes a better friend to Lisa.

episodes.title: Pokey Mom
episodes.description: Marge invites a convict to live in the house, while Homer starts a chiropractic business.

episodes.title: Worst Episode Ever
episodes.description: Comic Book Guy turns the store over to Bart and Milhouse and they discover a collection of videos.

episodes.title: Tennis the Menace
episodes.description: When Homer installs a tennis court, Bart and Marge become a successful team and Homer gets jealous.

episodes.title: Day of the Jackanapes
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob returns and attempts to use Bart as a living bomb to kill Krusty the Clown.

episodes.title: New Kids On the Blecch
episodes.description: Bart becomes a member of a popular boy band, but the band learns they are pawns of the US Navy.

episodes.title: Hungry, Hungry Homer
episodes.description: Homer learns a baseball team is moving to Albuquerque. To stop them Homer stages a hunger strike.

episodes.title: Bye, Bye, Nerdie
episodes.description: Lisa tries to understand the hidden causes of bullyism and Homer sets up a childproofing business.

episodes.title: Simpson Safari
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit Africa and meet a researcher who is exploiting monkeys to mine for diamonds.

episodes.title: Trilogy of Error
episodes.description: Homer cuts off his thumb, Lisa builds a robot, and Bart and Milhouse get involved with fireworks.

episodes.title: I'm Goin' to Praiseland
episodes.description: Marge and Homer attempt to get Ned past the death of his wife, but he is not ready to date.

episodes.title: Children of a Lesser Clod
episodes.description: Homer sets up a day care center and earns the love of the town - but not his own son and daughter.

episodes.title: Simpsons Tall Tales
episodes.description: Lisa tries to save the world as Connie Appleseed. Bart and Nelson become Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XII
episodes.description: On Halloween, a gypsy curses Homer ; Lisa and Bart get themselves in a Harry Potter-like adventure.

episodes.title: The Parent Rap
episodes.description: When Bart's arrested for joyriding, a no-nonsense judge orders Homer to be shackled to his son 24/7.

episodes.title: Homer to the Moe
episodes.description: When Moe returns from bartending school, Homer leads the barflies to his own watering hole.

episodes.title: A Hunka Hunka Burns in Love
episodes.description: Mr. Burns finds a woman who turns out to be the girlfriend of the violent convict Snake.

episodes.title: The Blunder Years
episodes.description: Homer recalls a dead body he once saw and Marge gets a crush on the man on a paper towel wrapper.

episodes.title: She of Little Faith
episodes.description: In this Christmas episode Richard Gere offers Buddhist teachings to Lisa after leaving her church.

episodes.title: Brawl in the Family
episodes.description: The Simpsons are confined to their home and brawl violently until a social worker is called in.

episodes.title: Sweets and Sour Marge
episodes.description: Springfield enters the world records as the world’s fattest town, so Marge tries to ban sugar.

episodes.title: Jaws Wired Shut
episodes.description: Homer becomes a better man after breaking his jaw, which leads Marge to miss the old him.

episodes.title: Half-Decent Proposal
episodes.description: Marge’s old beau, Artie, offers Homer a million dollars to let him spend a weekend with Marge.

episodes.title: The Bart Wants What It Wants
episodes.description: Rainier Wolfcastle's daughter, whose crush on has an unrequited crush on Bart.

episodes.title: The Lastest Gun in the West
episodes.description: An old cowboy star whose newest pal, Bart, tries to land him a guest shot on Krusty's show.

episodes.title: The Old Man and the Key
episodes.description: Grampa regains his driver's license to woo a new woman, but is goaded into a race by senior punks.

episodes.title: Tales from the Public Domain
episodes.description: Homer goes on the Odyssey, Lisa meets a fiery fate as Joan of Arc, and Bart becomes Prince Hamlet.

episodes.title: Blame It On Lisa
episodes.description: The Simpsons discover Lisa sponsors an orphan in Brazil so they travel to Rio.

episodes.title: Weekend at Burnsie's
episodes.description: Homer's addicted to medicinal marijuana. When the drug is recriminalized, Homer must go cold turkey.

episodes.title: Gump Roast
episodes.description: The Friars Club roasts Homer, with Krusty introducing friends, family and memories from the past.

episodes.title: I Am Furious (Yellow)
episodes.description: Bart creates an internet cartoon based on Homer and Stan Lee won't leave Comic Book Guy’s store.

episodes.title: The Sweetest Apu
episodes.description: The Simpsons help reconcile Apu's marriage after his affair with a woman who delivers to his store.

episodes.title: Little Girl in the Big Ten
episodes.description: Lisa befriends college gymnasts. Bart is forced to live in a bubble, isolated from the world.

episodes.title: The Frying Game
episodes.description: Homer befriends an elderly woman and when she is killed, Homer is blamed for her murder.

episodes.title: Poppa's Got a Brand New Badge
episodes.description: Homer starts a company that ultimately replaces the cops - and runs afoul of mobster Fat Tony.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIII
episodes.description: Springfield faces a horde of Homers and the people become half-human/half-animal monstrosities.

episodes.title: How I Spent My Strummer Vacation
episodes.description: Homer is taught by rock 'n' roll legends when he attends a rock-and-roll fantasy camp.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Lisa vs. the Third Grade
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa are in the same class and they are forced to be "buddies" on a field trip together.

episodes.title: Large Marge
episodes.description: Marge's new implants come to the rescue when an elephant gets out of control.

episodes.title: Helter Shelter
episodes.description: The Simpsons are forced to live as people did a 100 years ago and it nearly splits the family apart.

episodes.title: The Great Louse Detective
episodes.description: Someone's trying to kill Homer, so Chief Wiggum consults an expert: Sideshow Bob.

episodes.title: Special Edna
episodes.description: Mrs. Krabappel is nomianted for Teacher of the Year, and is invited to the ceremony at EFCOT Center.

episodes.title: The Dad Who Knew Too Little
episodes.description: Homer hires a P.I. to dig up information on Lisa, but ends up getting themselves framed for a crime.

episodes.title: The Strong Arms of the Ma
episodes.description: After being mugged, Marge lifts weights to regain her confidence but becomes addicted to steroids.

episodes.title: Pray Anything
episodes.description: Homer decides that the power of prayer can answer any problem and is given the deed to the church.

episodes.title: Barting Over
episodes.description: Bart learns that he was once a child star whose earnings were squandered by Homer.

episodes.title: I'm Spelling as Fast as I Can
episodes.description: Lisa is invited to the Spellympics and Homer follows a rib sandwich around Krusty Burger franchises.

episodes.title: A Star Is Born-Again
episodes.description: A movie star falls for Flanders enough to move to Springfield when he disdains going Hollywood.

episodes.title: Mr. Spritz Goes to Washington
episodes.description: The Simpsons convince Krusty to run for Congress, and he discovers the system is corrupt.

episodes.title: C.E. D'oh
episodes.description: Mr. Burns' lack of appreciation prompts Homer to plot revenge, resulting in a power plant takeover.

episodes.title: 'Scuse Me While I Miss the Sky
episodes.description: A documentarian influences Lisa as he shoots “A Day in the Life of Springfield Elementary.”

episodes.title: Three Gays of the Condo
episodes.description: A rift with Marge over drinking sends Homer into a condo which he shares with two gay men.

episodes.title: Dude, Where's My Ranch?
episodes.description: At a dude ranch, Lisa falls in love and Homer and Bart rescue people from beavers.

episodes.title: Old Yeller-Belly
episodes.description: The Simpsons' dog is discovered by beer magnate H. K. Duff and becomes a spokesmodel.

episodes.title: Brake My Wife, Please
episodes.description: Homer discovers walking makes him happier and healthier, until he is hit by a car driven by Marge!

episodes.title: The Bart of War
episodes.description: Bart and Milhouse are placed in separate youth groups and turn against each other.

episodes.title: Moe Baby Blues
episodes.description: A traffic jam causes Maggie to nearly fall in the river, only to be saved inadvertently by Moe.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIV
episodes.description: Professor Frink's father goes on a rampage after being brought back from the dead.

episodes.title: My Mother the Carjacker
episodes.description: Homer’s mother returns, and he finally achieves his dream of having her live in his house once more.

episodes.title: The President Wore Pearls
episodes.description: Lisa leads a student strike and is banished to a school for the gifted and troublesome.

episodes.title: The Regina Monologues
episodes.description: Bart earns enough money that he can afford to take the Simpsons to England.

episodes.title: The Fat and the Furriest
episodes.description: Homer is attacked by a bear and builds a suit designed to enable him to get revenge.

episodes.title: Today I Am a Clown
episodes.description: Krusty gets bar mitzvahed and Homer replaces him on the Sabbath with a talk show.

episodes.title: 'Tis the Fifteenth Season
episodes.description: A version of “A Christmas Carol” causes Homer to go become giving, prompting jealousy in Flanders.

episodes.title: Marge Versus Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens and Gays
episodes.description: The townspeople protest, resulting in a ballot measure to decide the direction of Springfield.

episodes.title: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot
episodes.description: To win his son's love, Homer enters a violent battle-bot contest and pays a huge physical price.

episodes.title: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife
episodes.description: Marge writes a novel in which Homer is the thinly-disguised villain, and Flanders the hero.

episodes.title: Margical History Tour
episodes.description: Lisa, as Sacagawea, is behind Lenny Lewis and Carl Clark, and Bart is a boorishly-behaving Mozart.

episodes.title: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore
episodes.description: Milhouse moves, and Bart is devastated. Meanwhile, Homer earns a small fortune as a beggar.

episodes.title: Smart & Smarter
episodes.description: When Lisa runs away to live in the museum, her family must go through a human body to rescue her.

episodes.title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner
episodes.description: Marge's old flame, Artie Ziff, tries to get Homer to take the fall for his failing company.

episodes.title: Co-Dependents' Day
episodes.description: Disappointed by a Cosmic Wars movie, Bart and Lisa go to wine country to complain to the filmmaker.

episodes.title: The Wandering Juvie
episodes.description: Bart's sentenced to juvie, where he is shackled to a girl who despises — and has a crush on — him.

episodes.title: My Big Fat Geek Wedding
episodes.description: Skinner finally agrees to marry Edna, but he gets cold feet and blows the deal.

episodes.title: Catch 'em if You Can
episodes.description: Homer and Marge take a break from Bart and Lisa, leading the kids to chase them cross-country.

episodes.title: Simple Simpson
episodes.description: Homer becomes a superhero after pie-ing a judge at a county fair.

episodes.title: The Way We Weren't
episodes.description: Homer's confession that his first kiss wasn't with Marge prompts his story of a summer-camp romance.

episodes.title: Bart-Mangled Banner
episodes.description: The Simpsons are exiled to a post 9-11 secret internment camp after Bart moons the flag.

episodes.title: Fraudcast News
episodes.description: Mr. Burns attempts to control all media in Springfield, but can't get his hands on Lisa’s newspaper.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XV
episodes.description: Flanders has death premonitions and Lisa and Bart probe murders in 1890s London

episodes.title: All's Fair in Oven War
episodes.description: Havoc erupts when the Simpsons remodel. Bart's enthralled by adult magazines without the adult part.

episodes.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
episodes.description: Bart's tormented by a bully while Lisa fears she can never be thin enough.

episodes.title: She Used to Be My Girl
episodes.description: Marge wonders what life would be like if she had a career in journalism instead of having a family.

episodes.title: Fat Man and Little Boy
episodes.description: Bart loses his last baby tooth and suddenly feels old so he pours himself into a new business.

episodes.title: Midnight Rx
episodes.description: Mr. Burns terminates the prescription drug program, so Grampa and the seniors smuggle drugs.

episodes.title: Mommie Beerest
episodes.description: Marge converts Moe's bar into an English pub, and Homer fears they have an “emotional affair.”

episodes.title: Homer and Ned's Hail Mary Pass
episodes.description: Homer encourages athletes to develop taunts and Ned Flanders is so outraged, he makes his own movie.

episodes.title: Pranksta Rap
episodes.description: Bart's forbidden from going to a hip-hop concert. To cover up his lie, he pretends to be kidnapped.

episodes.title: There's Something About Marrying
episodes.description: To restore its tourist business, Springfield legalizes gay marriage and Homer becomes a minister.

episodes.title: On a Clear Day I Can't See My Sister
episodes.description: When Bart embarasses Lisa during a field trip, she gets a restraining order against him.

episodes.title: Goo Goo Gai Pan
episodes.description: Selma goes through menopause and she decides to go to China to adopt a child.

episodes.title: Mobile Homer
episodes.description: Marge worries what they'd do for money when Homer is gone, so Homer purchases a mobile home.

episodes.title: The Seven-Beer Snitch
episodes.description: Mr. Burns repurposes a concert hall as a prison, and Lisa discovers her cat has a double life.

episodes.title: Future-Drama
episodes.description: Prof. Frink reveals the future to teenage Bart and a Yale-bound Lisa.

episodes.title: Don't Fear the Roofer
episodes.description: Homer finally meet a friendly contractor, however, the rest of the family doubts he even exists.

episodes.title: The Heartbroke Kid
episodes.description: The school vending machine sells unhealthy snacks, so Bart becomes particularly addicted to sweets.

episodes.title: A Star Is Torn
episodes.description: Lisa enters a contest and  Homer becomes an overprotective stage parent.

episodes.title: Thank God It's Doomsday
episodes.description: A film about the rapture convinces Homer the end of the world is near.

episodes.title: The Father, The Son And The Holy Guest Star
episodes.description: A priest counsels Bart and Homer, who embrace faith when an expelled Bart attends Catholic school.

episodes.title: Home Away from Homer
episodes.description: Flanders decides to move when he learns the town was mocking him behind his back.

episodes.title: The Bonfire of the Manatees
episodes.description: Homer loans the house to an adult filmmaker, so Marge runs off and meets a handsome, athletic man.

episodes.title: The Girl Who Slept Too Little
episodes.description: A cemetery is opened next to the Simpson house. Lisa grows too afraid to sleep in her own bed.

episodes.title: Milhouse of Sand and Fog
episodes.description: Homer throws a chicken pox party and Milhouse’s parents take the first steps towards reconciliation.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVI
episodes.description: The Simpsons replace Bart with an artificial boy, and Springfield’s costumes are frighteningly real.

episodes.title: Marge's Son Poisoning
episodes.description: Marge fears Bart will be a mama’s boy. Meanwhile, Homer gets one of his arms incredibly strong.

episodes.title: See Homer Run
episodes.description: When Homer is indifferent to Lisa’s Father’s Day gift, he tries to win back her affection.

episodes.title: The Last Of The Red Hat Mamas
episodes.description: Marge joins a group of women who have a sinister secret. Lisa sees a surprising side to Milhouse.

episodes.title: The Italian Bob
episodes.description: The Simpsons go to Italy to get a car for Mr. Burns, and discover  Sideshow Bob is a beloved mayor.

episodes.title: Simpsons Christmas Stories
episodes.description: The Simpsons appear in 3 tales: the story of Jesus' birth; a WWIII tale and a Christmas musical.

episodes.title: Homer's Paternity Coot
episodes.description: Homer suspects Grampa is not who he seems, and that his true father's a charming British adventurer.

episodes.title: We're On the Road to D'ohwhere
episodes.description: Homer must drive Bart cross-country to camp when the family discovers Bart is on the no-fly list.

episodes.title: My Fair Laddy
episodes.description: Lisa determines to musically make a gentleman out of Groundskeeper Willie.

episodes.title: The Seemingly Neverending Story
episodes.description: The Simpsons, when trapped in a cave, relate a complicated tale of love and money.

episodes.title: Bart Has Two Mommies
episodes.description: A mother ape decides she loves Bart. Meanwhile, Marge grows attached to the Flanders boys.

episodes.title: Homer Simpson, This Is Your Wife
episodes.description: Homer trades wives with a henpecked British man who falls hard for Marge.

episodes.title: Million-Dollar Abie
episodes.description: Grampa becomes a bullfighter before realizing the sport is too grisly for him.

episodes.title: Kiss Kiss, Bang Bangalore
episodes.description: Springfield Nuclear outsources to India, and Homer goes mad when he attempts to run the plant.

episodes.title: The Wettest Stories Ever Told
episodes.description: The Simpsons land at Plymouth Rock, Skinner fends off a mutiny, and a wave ruins a luxury cruise.

episodes.title: Girls Just Want to Have Sums
episodes.description: The school is divided between the sexes, and Lisa sneaks over to the other side to  learn math.

episodes.title: Regarding Margie
episodes.description: Marge loses her memory, and most tragically, forgets why she loves Homer.

episodes.title: The Monkey Suit
episodes.description: Springfield Elementary stops the teaching of evolution.

episodes.title: Marge and Homer Turn a Couple Play
episodes.description: Homer and Marge become marriage counselors for a troubled ballplayer and his sultry singing wife.

episodes.title: The Mook, the Chef, the Wife, and Her Homer
episodes.description: Lisa meets Fat Tony’s son, Michael. When Tony is wounded, Homer becomes head of the mob.

episodes.title: Jazzy and the Pussycats
episodes.description: A therapist suggests a harmless outlet for Bart’s energies and he becomes a terrific drummer.

episodes.title: Please Homer, Don't Hammer 'Em
episodes.description: Marge does carpentry work, meanwhile Bart and Principal Skinner discover their food allergies.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVII
episodes.description: Homer becomes a huge Blob, a Jewish guardian appears at school and the town falls victim to a hoax.

episodes.title: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt)
episodes.description: Bart signs up to be a soldier when he turns 18. Homer gets him out of it, then signs up himself.

episodes.title: Moe'N'a Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa discovers Moe's Bukowski-like poetic talent and takes him to a literary conference in Vermont.

episodes.title: Ice Cream of Margie (with the Light Blue Hair)
episodes.description: Homer begins driving an ice cream truck and Marge begins making sculptures from his popsicle sticks.

episodes.title: The Haw-Hawed Couple
episodes.description: Bart is the only kid to show up at Nelson the bully’s birthday and they become friends.

episodes.title: Kill Gil, Volumes I & II
episodes.description: Gil moves in with the Simpsons and Marge decides she needs to tell him off, ruining his life.

episodes.title: The Wife Aquatic
episodes.description: The Simpsons visit an island and Homer joins the crew of a doomed ship that gets caught in a storm.

episodes.title: Revenge Is a Dish Best Served Three Times
episodes.description: Milhouse helps lead the nerds over the bullies, and we see the iconic origin of Bartman.

episodes.title: Little Big Girl
episodes.description: Bart gets a drivers license and falls for a girl. Lisa lies about her heritage on an assignment.

episodes.title: Springfield Up
episodes.description: In this satire of the “Up” documentaries, we see Springfieldians at key points in their lives.

episodes.title: Yokel Chords
episodes.description: Lisa tutors the Spuckler children, while Bart scares the entire school with a phony tale of terror.

episodes.title: Rome-Old and Juli-Eh
episodes.description: Grampa marries Selma, while Bart and Lisa wage war with a package delivery service.

episodes.title: Homerazzi
episodes.description: Homer becomes a paparazzo, earning the enmity of Springfield’s celebrities.

episodes.title: Marge Gamer
episodes.description: Homer becomes a soccer referee, while Marge aggravates Bart by joining his violent online game.

episodes.title: The Boys of Bummer
episodes.description: Bart loses a key game for his little league team, and becomes an outcast in the town.

episodes.title: Crook and Ladder
episodes.description: Homer gets addicted to medication, then joins with Apu, Moe and Principal Skinner to become firemen.

episodes.title: Stop! Or My Dog Will Shoot!
episodes.description: Homer gets lost in a maze, then saved by Santa’s Little Helper, who becomes a police dog.

episodes.title: 24 Minutes
episodes.description: Marge rushes to a bake sale, Homer rids himself on yogurt and bullies try to stink bomb the school.

episodes.title: You Kent Always Say What You Want
episodes.description: In the 400th episode of the Simpsons, Kent Brockman loses his job for uttering a profanity on air.

episodes.title: He Loves to Fly and He D'oh's
episodes.description: Homer is thrilled to ride on Mr. Burns' private plane to Chicago.

episodes.title: The Homer of Seville
episodes.description: An injury gives Homer the ability to sing in an operatic voice, making him popular with the ladies.

episodes.title: Midnight Towboy
episodes.description: Homer becomes a tow truck driver. Meanwhile Marge raises Maggie with a controversial approach.

episodes.title: I Don't Wanna Know Why the Caged Bird Sings
episodes.description: While at the bank Marge is enmeshed in a robbery. She befriends the robber then has second thoughts.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XVIII
episodes.description: Marge and Homer are professional assassins, and Flanders opens an alternative to haunted houses.

episodes.title: Little Orphan Millie
episodes.description: Milhouse's parents disappear, and Homer is in trouble because he can't remember Marge's eye color.

episodes.title: Husbands and Knives
episodes.description: A comic book store opens in town and Comic Book Guy is aghast. Marge becomes a businesswoman.

episodes.title: Funeral for a Fiend
episodes.description: Sideshow Bob opens a restaurant with an assumed name and lures in the Simpsons, then seemingly dies.

episodes.title: Eternal Moonshine of the Simpson Mind
episodes.description: Homer cannot remember last night when something awful happened to Marge and his family disappeared.

episodes.title: E Pluribus Wiggum
episodes.description: Ralph runs for president in the nation primary, promising to make America great again.

episodes.title: That '90s Show
episodes.description: In a flashback, Marge is attracted to her professor and Homer sings in a grunge band, Sadgasm.

episodes.title: Love, Springfieldian Style
episodes.description: The Simpsons explore the romantic lives of Bonnie and Clyde, Sid and Nancy and Lady and the Tramp.

episodes.title: The Debarted
episodes.description: Bart befriends a cool older kid only to discover he is a plant working for Principal Skinner.

episodes.title: Dial "N" for Nerder
episodes.description: Bart and Lisa killed Martin Prince? Marge employs a TV show to see if Homer's cheating on his diet.

episodes.title: Smoke On the Daughter
episodes.description: Lisa takes ballet and becomes addicted to second-hand smoke.  Meanwhile Homer and Bart make jerky.

episodes.title: Papa Don't Leech
episodes.description: Homer's former protege Lurleen Lumpkin returns with her no-good hamboning father in tow.

episodes.title: Apocalypse Cow
episodes.description: Bart raises a prize calf only to be terrified when it is sold for slaughter.

episodes.title: Any Given Sundance
episodes.description: Lisa enters a film in the Sundance festival and the documentary proves embarassing to her family.

episodes.title: Mona Leaves-a
episodes.description: Homer's mother returns to him, then dies. To cope, he tries to honor her unusual last wishes.

episodes.title: All About Lisa
episodes.description: Mr. Burns losing a penny, and we see the rise of Lisa as Krusty's assistant, narrated by Mel.

episodes.title: Sex, Pies, and Idiot Scrapes
episodes.description: Homer and Marge get new jobs; Homer as a bounty hunter and Marge as a baker at an erotic bakery.

episodes.title: Lost Verizon
episodes.description: Bart pretends to be a celebrity after finding Denis Leary's phone while working at a country club.

episodes.title: Double, Double, Boy in Trouble
episodes.description: Bart switches places with his doppelganger, Simon, and notices his new siblings acting strangely.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIX
episodes.description: Transformer-like robots duke it out, Homer kills off celebrities, and Lisa goes to a pumpkin patch.

episodes.title: Dangerous Curves
episodes.description: Homer and Marge reminisce about their courtship, while Bart and Lisa recall their early childhood.

episodes.title: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words
episodes.description: Lisa becomes an expert at crossword puzzles and enters a tournament, where Homer bets against her.

episodes.title: MyPods and Boomsticks
episodes.description: Lisa gets a MyPod at the mall, and Homer becomes suspicious of Bart's new Muslim friend, Bashir.

episodes.title: The Burns and the Bees
episodes.description: Mr. Burns decides to build a sports arena, but the last bee colony is on the proposed site.

episodes.title: Lisa the Drama Queen
episodes.description: Lisa and her friend develop a fantasy world. But Marge forbids Lisa to see Juliet so Lisa runs away.

episodes.title: Take My Life, Please
episodes.description: Homer learns of election fraud in the race for senior-class president of his high school.

episodes.title: How the Test Was Won
episodes.description: As the school preps for standardized tests, the "underperformers" are whisked away to Capital City.

episodes.title: No Loan Again, Naturally
episodes.description: Homer's questionable financing of his Mardi Gras bash forces the family to lose their house.

episodes.title: Gone Maggie Gone
episodes.description: Homer loses Maggie to nuns in a convent while Marge temporarily loses her sight.

episodes.title: In the Name of the Grandfather
episodes.description: The Simpsons buy a pub in Ireland and find out the Irish no longer hang out in pubs.

episodes.title: Wedding for Disaster
episodes.description: Homer asks Marge to renew their vows, but he mysteriously disappears before the wedding.

episodes.title: Eeny Teeny Maya, Moe
episodes.description: Moe has a date with a woman who turns out to be a little person, so Moe must adjust his attitude.

episodes.title: The Good, the Sad and the Drugly
episodes.description: When a jealous Milhouse learns of Bart's romance, he threatens to reveal Bart's past.

episodes.title: Father Knows Worst
episodes.description: Homer becomes a hovering parent when he learns Bart and Lisa are struggling at school.

episodes.title: Waverly Hills 9-0-2-1-D'oh
episodes.description: The Simpsons rent an apartment in a better school district but the new school is not very welcoming.

episodes.title: Four Great Women and a Manicure
episodes.description: Marge and Lisa get mani-pedis. While there, they swap stories about powerful women through history.

episodes.title: Coming to Homerica
episodes.description: Swarms of unemployed workers descend on Springfield, so the mayor closes the borders.

episodes.title: Homer the Whopper
episodes.description: Comic Book guy creates a comic book--"Everyman"- and Homer is cast in the lead.

episodes.title: Bart Gets a 'Z'
episodes.description: Bart tries to loosen up his teacher by spiking her coffee and she gets so drunk, she loses her job.

episodes.title: The Great Wife Hope
episodes.description: The Ultimate Punch, Kick and Choke Championship comes to town and Marge tries to ban the "sport".

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XX
episodes.description: Lisa's drawn into a plot, Krusty invents a fast-food and Moe's microbrew has a vile ingredient.

episodes.title: The Devil Wears Nada
episodes.description: Marge poses for a calendar,  resulting in provocative photos that make her the talk of the town.

episodes.title: Pranks and Greens
episodes.description: Bart learns of a prankster from Springfield's past and becomes fast friends with the joker.

episodes.title: Rednecks & Broomsticks
episodes.description: The Simpsons are stranded in hill country and introduced to the wonders of witchcraft and moonshine.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Bart Thou?
episodes.description: Bart decides he wants a brother after observing Lisa and Maggie's bond during a blizzard.

episodes.title: Thursdays with Abie
episodes.description: Grampa becomes famous when his anecdote about serving on a battleship in World War II is published.

episodes.title: Once Upon a Time in Springfield
episodes.description: Krusty gets a Disney-style princess sidekick. Mr. Burns eliminates donuts from the break room.

episodes.title: Million Dollar Maybe
episodes.description: Homer buys a million-dollar winner lottery ticket, but has to miss his date with Marge to do it.

episodes.title: Boy Meets Curl
episodes.description: Homer and Marge take up curling, but Marge's superior skills cause a rift between them.

episodes.title: The Color Yellow
episodes.description: Lisa researches her ancestors and learns her Southern forebears helped a slave escape to freedom.

episodes.title: Postcards from the Wedge
episodes.description: Bart gets in trouble for not turning in homework, and Homer and Marge use different parenting tacks.

episodes.title: Stealing First Base
episodes.description: Bart has a crush on a girl. Lisa's peers snub her, but First Lady Michelle Obama defends her.

episodes.title: The Greatest Story Ever D'ohed
episodes.description: Ned Flanders invites the Simpsons on a trip to the Holy Land. Homer believe he is the messiah.

episodes.title: American History X-cellent
episodes.description: Mr. Burns goes to jail and Smithers takes over the power plant, but employees take advantage of him.

episodes.title: Chief of Hearts
episodes.description: Homer befriends Chief Wiggum, but the friendship gets too close. Bart gets addicted to a game.

episodes.title: The Squirt & the Whale
episodes.description: The Simpsons use a wind turbine in their backyard, and Homer and Lisa try to rescue a blue whale.

episodes.title: To Surveil with Love
episodes.description: Springfield plunges into a nightmare when cameras are installed after a supposed terrorist attack.

episodes.title: Moe Letter Blues
episodes.description: Moe writes a letter to Homer, Apu and Rev. Lovejoy, threatening to run off with their wives.

episodes.title: The Bob Next Door
episodes.description: Bart believes his new neighbor Walt is Sideshow Bob in disguise, returning for revenge.

episodes.title: Judge Me Tender
episodes.description: Moe is invited to Los Angeles to judge American Idol where he befriends Simon Cowell.

episodes.title: Elementary School Musical
episodes.description: Lisa gets a dream week at camp, then finds her return to the real world is a little disheartening

episodes.title: Loan-a-Lisa
episodes.description: Lisa invests in Nelson's new business, but cautions him against dropping out of school as a result.

episodes.title: MoneyBart
episodes.description: Lisa manages Bart's little league team and introduces statistical analysis to the game.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXI
episodes.description: Lisa falls for a vampire and Marge and Homer's honeymoon at sea is interrupted by a castaway.

episodes.title: Lisa Simpson, This Isn't Your Life
episodes.description: Marge was once an excellent student. Bart accidentally beats up Nelson and becomes the school bully.

episodes.title: The Fool Monty
episodes.description: Mr. Burns only has weeks to live. Bart finds him in the wilderness and invites him into his home.

episodes.title: How Munched Is That Birdie in the Window?
episodes.description: Bart nurses a wounded pigeon back to health, but Santa's Little Helper has other plans.

episodes.title: The Fight Before Christmas
episodes.description: An edgy Christmas with the Simpsons. Katy Perry appears in a segment with puppets of the family.

episodes.title: Donnie Fatso
episodes.description: Homer is jailed on New Year's Eve for bribery and goes undercover as an informant against Fat Tony.

episodes.title: Moms I'd Like to Forget
episodes.description: Marge recalls "The Cool Moms," but when she reconnects with the group, there's trouble in paradise.

episodes.title: Flaming Moe
episodes.description: Moe turns his tavern into a gay bar, and a teacher becomes the passion of Principal Skinner's life.

episodes.title: Homer the Father
episodes.description: Homer learns about parenting from a 1980s sitcom.

episodes.title: The Blue and the Gray
episodes.description: Marge's hair turns gray, and the family has a hard time adjusting to the change.

episodes.title: Angry Dad: The Movie
episodes.description: When the “Angry Dad” character becomes an award-winning short film, Homer hogs the spotlight.

episodes.title: The Scorpion's Tale
episodes.description: Lisa discovers a drug that cures crankiness, and Bart starts illegally selling it to seniors.

episodes.title: A Midsummer's Nice Dreams
episodes.description: Legendary comics Cheech and Chong split up and Cheech asks Homer to replace his old partner.

episodes.title: Love Is a Many Strangled Thing
episodes.description: Homer's rage toward Bart gets him in trouble with a therapist, who reverses Bart and Homer's roles.

episodes.title: The Great Simpsina
episodes.description: Lisa becomes an apprentice to a magician and ends up embroiled in a showdown of the craft's elite.

episodes.title: The Real Housewives of Fat Tony
episodes.description: Fat Tony asks for Selma’s hand in marriage; Bart discovers a talent for sniffing out truffles.

episodes.title: Homer Scissorhands
episodes.description: Homer discovers his gift for hairstyling and women tell him more about men than he wants to know.

episodes.title: 500 Keys
episodes.description: The Simpsons get keys to every door in town. Lisa finds a classroom beneath Springfield Elementary.

episodes.title: The Ned-Liest Catch
episodes.description: Ned Flanders saves Edna Krabappel's life and they begin dating.

episodes.title: The Falcon and the D'ohman
episodes.description: Homer discovers his friend's an agent, whose enemies realize they can flush out by kidnapping Homer.

episodes.title: Bart Stops to Smell the Roosevelts
episodes.description: Superintendent Chalmers discovers he can reach Bart through study of our 26th president.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXII
episodes.description: A paralyzed Homer only communicates by passing gas.

episodes.title: Replaceable You
episodes.description: Bart's science project brings joy to the elderly and a coworker disrupts Homer's life at the plant.

episodes.title: The Food Wife
episodes.description: Marge discovers the joy of exotic food and it becomes a new activity for her and the kids.

episodes.title: The Book Job
episodes.description: Homer and Bart try to defraud a publishing house and settle on Lisa as the front for the operation.

episodes.title: The Man in the Blue Flannel Pants
episodes.description: After Homer hosts a party to promote Krusty's new liquor, Mr. Burns makes him an account exec.

episodes.title: The Ten-Per-Cent Solution
episodes.description: After Krusty's show is canceled, the Simpsons introduce him to another agent.

episodes.title: Holidays of Future Passed
episodes.description: 30 years in the future, Bart and Lisa discover the perils of parenthood in a post-apocalyptic world.

episodes.title: Politically Inept, with Homer Simpson
episodes.description: Homer's rant about airport security goes viral and he lands a radio talk show.

episodes.title: The D'oh-cial Network
episodes.description: When Lisa can't make friends, she tries to do so with an online network.

episodes.title: Moe Goes from Rags to Riches
episodes.description: The story of western civilization is recounted by Moe's bar rag.

episodes.title: The Daughter Also Rises
episodes.description: As Valentine's Day approaches, Marge grows concerned when Lisa finds a boyfriend.

episodes.title: At Long Last Leave
episodes.description: Fed up with the family’s impact on the city, townspeople banish the Simpsons from Springfield.

episodes.title: Exit Through the Kwik-E-Mart
episodes.description: Bart makes Homer's face an iconic graffiti image throughout Springfield.

episodes.title: How I Wet Your Mother
episodes.description: Homer is dismayed to discover he is an adult bedwetter.

episodes.title: Them, Robot
episodes.description: Mr. Burns replaces all of his employees with robots—with one exception: Homer.

episodes.title: Beware My Cheating Bart
episodes.description: Homer gets wrapped up in a series that finished years ago, only to have Marge spoil the ending.

episodes.title: A Totally Fun Thing That Bart Will Never Do Again
episodes.description: Bart convinces his parents to take a cruise that he wishes would never end.

episodes.title: The Spy Who Learned Me
episodes.description: Homer woos Marge with an imaginary spy, and Bart attempts to neutralize Nelson by fattening him up.

episodes.title: Ned 'n Edna's Blend Agenda
episodes.description: Complications ensue when Flanders and Krabappel admit they’re secretly married.

episodes.title: Lisa Goes Gaga
episodes.description: Lady Gaga arrives in Springfield and makes everyone feel like a little monster--except Lisa.

episodes.title: Moonshine River
episodes.description: Bart realizes all girls dump him within a week, so he goes to New York to find a former flame.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XXIII
episodes.description: A search for the Higgs Boson creates a black hole until it is stopped by a most unlikely hero.

episodes.title: Adventures in Baby-Getting
episodes.description: Marge's car makes her realize she wants another baby and Lisa mysteriously vanishes after school.

episodes.title: Gone Abie Gone
episodes.description: Grampa disappears, and while trying to find him they learn he had a second wife.

episodes.title: Penny-Wiseguys
episodes.description: Fat Tony names his accountant head of the mob. Meanwhile, vegetarian Lisa starts eating bugs.

episodes.title: A Tree Grows in Springfield
episodes.description: A depressed Homer wins a myPad and the tablet changes his life--until it breaks.

episodes.title: The Day the Earth Stood Cool
episodes.description: Portland comes to Springfield in the form of Homer's new hipster neighbors.

episodes.title: To Cur with Love
episodes.description: Grampa reveals that Homer had a dog as a boy that he was forced to give up.

episodes.title: Homer Goes to Prep School
episodes.description: Homer meets preppers who help him get ready for the imminent end of the world.

episodes.title: A Test Before Trying
episodes.description: Bart must pass a test to save Springfield Elementary.

episodes.title: The Changing of the Guardian
episodes.description: Marge and Homer realize they do not have suitable guardians for their children.

episodes.title: Love Is a Many-Splintered Thing
episodes.description: Bart looks back at love from middle age in this homage to Annie Hall.

episodes.title: Hardly Kirk-Ing
episodes.description: Bart and Milhouse discover that they can convince everyone Milhouse is his dad.

episodes.title: Gorgeous Grampa
episodes.description: The Simpsons discover that Grampa was a "bad guy" pro wrestler in the '50s.

episodes.title: Black Eyed, Please
episodes.description: Lisa gets picked on by a bully who happens to be her teacher. Flanders punches Homer in the eye.

episodes.title: Dark Knight Court
episodes.description: Easter's ruined and all fingers point to Bart, and Mr. Burns becomes an ineffectual superhero.

episodes.title: What Animated Women Want
episodes.description: Homer learns the four f's of dealing with women while Milhouse discovers the secret to Lisa's heart.

episodes.title: Pulpit Friction
episodes.description: A new preacher comes to Springfield Presbylutheran and wins the congregation's affections.

episodes.title: Whiskey Business
episodes.description: A suicide attempt gone awry prompts Marge to buy Moe a fancy suit to improve his outlook on life.

episodes.title: The Fabulous Faker Boy
episodes.description: Bart takes piano lessons and disappoints his mother with his lack of talent at a recital.

episodes.title: The Saga of Carl
